title: Drawing, "Design for a Glass Panel Window for the Coved Ceiling in the Music Room", ca. 1817
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Vertical rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. A lozenge-shaped panel. The central design is composed of two winged insects arranged symmetrically within a circle. This design is flanked by two diamond-shaped fields containing a stylized bud motif.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Glass Panel Window for the Coved Ceiling in the Music Room", ca. 1817.
ca. 1817. Watercolor on paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-89.
